thread.title: Pollution killing the poor

author: news24.com
title: Pollution killing the poor
text:
London - Policy makers could save millions of lives worldwide with simple, cheap measures to tackle the "low hanging fruit" of dirty air and water, said the author of a new book on pollution.
Pollution is the biggest killer in poorer countries, with more people dying because of it than from either wars, malnutrition, smoking, malaria or even HIV, said Richard Fuller, citing data from the World Health Organization.
